title: Weather Window Risk Score
description: Estimate weather risk for the selected trip window using precipitation, wind, and temperature spread.
pageDescription: Score route-day weather risk before you commit to a departure window.

sections.title: How It Works
content: Combines precipitation probability, wind speed, and temperature spread into a 0-100 risk score.
Adds extra penalties for freezing lows, heat spikes, and high-wind conditions.
Returns a quick level: Low, Moderate, or High risk.

sections.title: When To Use
content: Choosing between two departure dates for a road trip or bike ride.
Evaluating camp setup risk for exposed locations.
Deciding whether to shorten route distance or add backup shelter options.

sections.title: Practical Tips
content: Use conservative inputs from the worst part of your planned window.
If risk is High, reduce route complexity and increase bailout options.
Re-check within 12-24 hours of departure for better forecast accuracy.
